sections.Situation: On a quest to get to a Yoko Okino concert Kogoro breaks his foot, while the Detective Boys visit the hospital, they are unaware that a patient in Kogoro's room is one of the bank robbers. Along the way, a visiting father is separated from his daughter by the remaining robbers, and the only way he can get her back is by murdering the robber.

sections.Manga to anime changes:
- The following scenes were made for the anime version:
Kogoro getting his leg broken and asking the paramedics to take him to Yoko's show, as well as the Detective Boys looking for his hospital room.
Daizaburo tells the Detective Boys about the bank robbery with a flashback shown.
After Yoshio leaves the room, Kogoro and the Detective Boys talk about where the bank robbers could be hiding with Kogoro making a joke about them being in the suburbs. Genta responds hoping that his other leg gets broken with Mitsuhiko stating that they should let him be hospitalized forever. Kogoro asks Daizaburo for his imput only to find he fell asleep and thinks he's just tired. He then asks the Detective Boys to take him to the lobby so he can watch Yoko. A radio is shown taped under his bed.
A flashback detailing the car accident.
The Detective Boys moving Kogoro to the lobby with Conan accidentally getting kicked in the face by Kogoro's casted leg.
Ran coming to check up on Kogoro only to find him dancing in the lobby while watching Yoko. Kogoro eventually breaks his other leg, with Rans ignoring him.

- This is the first episode of the Funimation Dub to have George voiced by Mike McFarland.
sections.Trivia:
- The ambulance with license plate number 新宿 88, せ 41-67 (Shinjuku 88, Se 41-67) reappers in The Traveling Drama Troupe Murder Case (Part 1), The Coffee Shop Truck's Wild Entrance Case, and Head-to-Head Match with the Black Organization: A Dual Mystery on a Full Moon Night.
- When Takagi told Megure that Kogoro broke his right leg, Megure stated that he broke that same leg not so long ago, in General Hospital Murder Case.
